back_cards.example_en: She mixed the ingredients for the cake.
He mixed with colleagues at the party.
They mixed paint to get the right color.
The DJ mixed songs seamlessly.
She mixed styles to create a unique look.
The snow covered the ground overnight.
The snow made driving difficult.
Kids played in the snow all day.
Her dress was white as snow.
The snow signaled winter’s arrival.
They implemented the new policy.
She implemented the plan successfully.
The team implemented safety measures.
He implemented the changes requested.
The company implemented a new system.
She used the proper tool for the job.
He wore proper attire for the event.
The proper procedure was followed.
Her manners were always proper.
The city proper was bustling.
Their marketing campaign boosted sales.
She studied marketing in college.
Effective marketing increased their reach.
Marketing helped identify customer needs.
The marketing team launched the product.
The board approved the budget.
She approved the final design.
He approved of her decision.
The manager approved the leave request.
They approved the new policy.
The bomb was safely disarmed.
The movie was a box office bomb.
The news was a bomb in the industry.
That party was the bomb!
The bomb caused widespread damage.
She slipped on the wet floor.
He slipped out of the room.
Sales slipped during the recession.
He slipped and revealed the secret.
Time slipped away during the meeting.
The regional office handled local issues.
Regional cuisine varied widely.
The regional tournament was intense.
She studied regional history.
The regional dialect was unique.
He strained a muscle while lifting.
She used muscle to move the box.
The company had the muscle to compete.
His leg muscle was sore after running.
The team put muscle into the project.
The rumor was completely false.
He gave a false name to the police.
The painting was a false masterpiece.
Her false statement caused confusion.
The false teeth looked natural.
The creation of the app took months.
Her dress was a beautiful creation.
The creation of the theory was groundbreaking.
Myths describe the creation of life.
His creation was displayed in the gallery.
She typically arrives early for work.
The weather is typically warm in July.
He typically avoids spicy food.
They typically work as a team.
The store is typically open till 9.
Her spending on clothes was high.
Government spending increased this year.
Spending time wisely is important.
The company’s spending was reviewed.
His spending habits were frugal.
The scalpel is a surgical instrument.
She played the violin, a string instrument.
Education is an instrument of change.
The lab’s instrument measured temperature.
The contract was a binding instrument.
A mass of people gathered downtown.
The mountain’s mass was impressive.
She attended Mass every Sunday.
The object’s mass was calculated.
The mass of data was analyzed.
The book was thick with pages.
The fog was thick in the morning.
He wore a thick jacket in winter.
The soup was thick and hearty.
Her hair was thick and shiny.
She kissed her baby on the forehead.
They kissed under the mistletoe.
The ball kissed the rim before falling.
He kissed her hand gently.
The waves kissed the shore.
Increased demand raised prices.
The increased budget allowed expansion.
Increased effort led to success.
Her increased confidence was noticeable.
Increased traffic caused delays.
Her speech inspired the team.
The sunset inspired his painting.
He inspired her to chase her dreams.
The story inspired hope in readers.
Her courage inspired others to act.
She separated the laundry by color.
They separated the group into teams.
The friends separated after the party.
He separated fact from fiction.
The couple decided to separate.
The noise from the street was distracting.
The radio had too much noise.
The crowd’s noise filled the stadium.
The data was full of noise.
The noise of rain was soothing.

back_cards.definition_en: A bright color like the sun
back_cards.example_en: She wore a yellow dress to the party.
The yellow flowers bloomed in spring.
He was called yellow for avoiding the challenge.
The yellow walls lit up the room.
The yellow pages of the book were fragile.
She aimed the arrow at the target.
They aim to finish by tomorrow.
He aimed to become a doctor.
The campaign aimed at young voters.
She aimed her camera at the sunset.
She sent an e-mail to her boss.
The e-mail contained important details.
His e-mail account was full.
The e-mail confirmed the meeting.
I’ll send you an e-mail tonight.
The water cycle sustains life.
The washing machine finished its cycle.
She rode her cycle to work.
The business cycle affects profits.
The moon’s cycle was full tonight.
The light was a signal to stop.
The radio signal was weak.
His nod was a signal to begin.
The phone lost its signal.
The bell was a signal for class.
She downloaded a new app for fitness.
The app helped her track expenses.
The navigation app saved time.
His favorite app was for gaming.
The app synced with her calendar.
The golden necklace sparkled.
It was a golden opportunity.
The golden sunset was breathtaking.
Their golden anniversary was celebrated.
She had a golden voice.
She rejected the job offer.
They rejected the faulty product.
He rejected her suggestion.
The school rejected his application.
She rejected his advances politely.
She informed the team about the change.
He informed her of the delay.
The guide informed us about the history.
They informed the police of the theft.
The brochure informed visitors about rules.
Her perception of the event was clear.
His perception of risk was low.
The smell changed her perception.
Public perception shaped the campaign.
Her perception of people was sharp.
The museum welcomed many visitors.
The visitor explored the city.
She was a visitor at the conference.
The visitor brought flowers to the patient.
The visitor felt welcomed by locals.
He cast the fishing line into the water.
They cast her in the lead role.
The statue was cast in bronze.

back_cards.definition_en: To give a look or glance
back_cards.example_en: She cast a smile his way.
The light cast shadows on the wall.
The contrast between colors was striking.
Her speech was a contrast to his.
The contrast in their styles was clear.
The photo’s contrast was adjusted.
The contrast highlighted their strengths.
Her judgment was trusted by all.
The court’s judgment was final.
His judgment in crises was sharp.
The judgment of the work was fair.
My judgment is to proceed cautiously.
The representative spoke for the group.
She voted for her representative.
The company sent a representative.
This painting is representative of his style.
The union’s representative negotiated terms.
The regime was known for strict rules.
The new regime promised reforms.
The regime of training was intense.
The regime lasted a decade.
Her fitness regime was disciplined.
It was merely a suggestion.
He’s merely a beginner at chess.
The issue was merely a misunderstanding.
She spoke merely to clarify.
It was merely a coincidence.
The producer oversaw the film’s production.
The producer supplied fresh vegetables.
She’s a music producer for the band.
The producer negotiated the deal.
The region is a major oil producer.
Whoa, that was a close call!
Whoa, slow down the horse!
Whoa, look at that huge wave!
Whoa, let’s think this through.
Whoa, I didn’t expect that news!

back_cards.definition_en: A path or way to travel
back_cards.example_en: The route to the lake was scenic.
The delivery route was optimized.
They took a new route home.
Her route to success was hard work.
The data followed a secure route.
It was a typical sunny day.
His behavior was typical of teenagers.
The meal was a typical Italian dish.
She’s a typical software engineer.
A typical workday starts at 9.
The analyst predicted market trends.
She’s a financial analyst at the firm.
The analyst reviewed the report.
The analyst explained the findings.
The analyst identified the issue.
They elected a new mayor.
She elected to study abroad.
He was elected as president.
They elected to postpone the event.
The board elected her as chair.
The smell of flowers filled the room.
The smell of rain was refreshing.
The smell from the trash was bad.
There was a smell of trouble.
Her smell of the soup confirmed it was ready.
Her disability didn’t stop her success.
The school accommodated his disability.
She received benefits for her disability.
The disability required adaptive tools.
He managed his disability with confidence.
Her comparison of prices saved money.
The comparison showed clear differences.
His comparison of cars was detailed.
The comparison to a storm was apt.
In comparison, her work stood out.
The movie received a high rating.
Her performance earned a top rating.
The hotel’s rating was five stars.
The product’s rating was positive.
The app’s rating was impressive.
The campus was lively with students.
She walked across the campus to class.
The campus had a new library.
Events were held on campus.
The campus offered many clubs.
